list.title: **Use a unique password for every site**
list.description: Although this will require a need for a password manager, it prevents a leaked password being used in multiple places.

list.title: **Never click links in emails related to accounts**
list.description: It is always safer to log into your account and manage it directly from the site instead of trusting an email.

list.title: **Use a VPN**
list.description: While most good VPNs cost money, they are often a good investment for your privacy. Try NordVPN, Norton, or Surfshark.

list.title: **Keep applications up to date**
list.description: Patches for apps usually include security updates so it is always good to stay updated.

list.title: **Try using a different browser**
list.description: Many browsers exist that allow users to keep their data hidden unlike many larger browsers such as Google Chrome.

list.title: **Use complex passwords**
list.description: Always try to use strong passwords that contain a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.

list.title: **Be careful about app permissions**
list.description: Always check to see what permissions apps you download have, don't allow access to unnesessary data.

list.title: **Don't skip through automatic downloads**
list.description: Often times downloads might try to install additional content like browser extensions or other software that you might not want.

list.title: **Use 2-factor authentication**
list.description: 2-factor authentication ensures that even if your email is compromised your accounts stay safe.

list.title: **Always be wary of scams and phishing attempts**
list.description: Most scams online require you to give away information unintentionally, so always being mindful when reading emails is one of the most important things you can do.

list.title: **Avoid accessing sensitive data on public wifi**
list.description: Try to avoid logging into accounts or accessing important information when on an unsecured or public network.

list.title: **Avoid account sharing**
list.description: While you might feel comfortable trusting your friends with an account you own, they might share it with their friends who you don't trust.

list.title: **Avoid keeping sensitive data accessible**
list.description: Screenshots of important information, or important emails become a lot harder to leak if you avoid creating them or keeping them on your devices for long periods of time.
